article_title: Can Republicans Repeal Obamacare Without Disrupting Coverage For Tens Of Millions?

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: In 2012, the conventional wisdom among conservatives and Republicans was that the presidential election of that year was of paramount importance. If Mitt Romney didn’t defeat President Obama, Obamacare’s trillions in health care subsidies would go online, and the law would become "impossible to repeal." That was then. Today, repeal remains the official position of the GOP. But Republicans haven't put as much thought into how to address the disruption that a careless version of repeal could incur.
og.title: Can Republicans Repeal Obamacare Without Disrupting Coverage For Tens Of Millions?
